AITA for rejecting Nick's mom's dying wish to see him before she passes away? | Here is the background of the situation, Nick and his mom never had a good relationship to start off. Around the age of 14, Nick's mom and dad had a nasty divorce that ultimately split the family in half. Nick has 4 sisters, 2 older and 2 younger and he is the only son. Nick's sisters left with his mom and Nick decided to stay with his dad.

The reason Nick decided to stay with his father was because one night he came into his room just crying. Telling him he has no one else left in this world except him. That night Nick promised to be by his side no matter what and always be there for him. Nick could see that his mom hated him for choosing to stay with his father.

Skip a few years later and Nick is 17 and living with his father still. Over the years his father slowly started drinking his pain away and it took a toll on him and Nick. He became an abusive father telling Nick that he reminds him of “Her” which is his mom but Nick stayed because he loved his dad and he promised to be with him no matter what.

Nick tried to keep in touch with his sisters however his mom hated that idea. Nick felt like his mom brainwashed his sisters to hate him for choosing his dad over her but he didn’t care. Nick tried to talk to his sisters over the phone, drive to their place and hang out with them because they were still his family. Except one day Nick went over to his mom's house to see his sisters and his mom, however she pulled him aside privately telling him its best to stay away from them because he would bring his dad's influence and he won’t be a good role model to his younger sisters. She told him that she doesn’t want to see him around ever and to stop hanging around his sisters and that broke his heart.

A year later Nick turned 18, and things just got worse, his dad became more angrier with the world and Nick was scared everyday locking his room, sometimes he would just spend nights in his car just to get away because he was afraid of what he becomes when he drinks. One day Nick just couldn’t take it anymore, he decided to pack his things and just leave because he doesn’t have a family anymore. Nick asked one his online video game buddy who lived 4 states away from him, if he would take a stranger into his home. He told Nick that he is family and he welcomed him into his family.

The day Nick decided to leave he told his dad that he is leaving and he is never coming back. The look he gave him, Nick could tell his soul just dropped out of his body. He just looked dead. Nick packed what little he had and went into his car. Lastly, Nick went to his mom's house and she was there alone and his younger siblings were at school. Nick told her that he is leaving and he is not coming back to this f#cked up family. That day she asked him if he finally got tired of his dad's shit and just told him to she doesn’t want to see him either. Nick just felt disgusted and just depressed. Nick tried to a be a son to his mother and father, he tried to be a brother but he just couldn’t do it anymore. That day Nick left to his friends home driving 21 hours straight, just crying. Nick arrived at his friends house and a week later he got a call from his uncle that his father committed suicide. Nick was devastated and blamed himself for his death because he promised to never leave his side.

Years later Nick is 23, it has been 5 years and not once he received a call from his mom or his sisters about his whereabouts or how he is doing. They didn’t bother come looking for him, nothing. Except one day his younger sister found him on social media and texted him through Facebook. She told him mom had developed pancreatic cancer and doesn’t have much time left. Nick kept in contact with his younger sister because he still gave a damn about his family deep inside him. Nick would text her about how everyone is doing, especially how was mom doing. They exchange numbers and they would call each other here and there.

One day Nick got a call from his younger sister and it happened to be his own mother. She told him that she isn’t doing so good, she doesn’t know how much time she has left and apologizes for being a bad mother towards him. She told him she wishes she could see him one last time before she passes away and in that moment, what she said just destroyed him. Nick responded by telling her No, he won’t come see her and that this is what she wanted and he just hung up the phone. Days later Nick got a call from his younger sister telling him that mom passed away and was crying a lot and Nick is an asshole for not being there for his own mom, Nick told her that she doesn’t understand what he has been put through and Nick hasn’t talked to his younger sister ever since then.

TL: DR: Nick's mom’s dying wish was for him to come see her before she passes away, Nick told her no because of their past differences and his younger sisters tells him he is an asshole and hasn’t spoke to him since.

AITA for not wanting Judy to live with her cousin after her mother passed away? | First of all sorry for the broken english, is not Judy's first language (F, 21).

On september of 2018 Judy's mom was diagnosed with stomachal cancer at stage four. The two of them lived in the capital of Judy's country, Judy is her only daughter and Judy's father passed away 19 years ago, since then Judy's mom was single and Judy's closer family, Judy's aunt and Judy's grandma, live four hours south of them. In the beginning they traveled once a month to see Judy's mom, they even spent christmas and new years with them that year, and it was great to feel the support of Judy's family at that time.

Sadly Judy's mom didn’t take her diagnosis really well and Judy had to start making decisions for the economic well being of the two of them, because cancer is a fucking expensive disease, such as having to move from a big and well located apartment to a smaller one in a modest part of the city that was just big enough to fit Judy's mom, Judy and a spare bed cause Judy thought they would come to visit, but in 2019 through all the period of time that Judy would go with her mom to chemos, hospitalized and everything Judy was alone with her.

They basically disappeared, Judy's grandma came to visit every 2 months but Judy's aunt literally disappeared, of course she would call Judy and tell Judy to go visit her but Judy was a nineteen year old woman taking care of her sick mother, the economy of the house and going to med school, so Judy didn’t have any time of energy to travel to visit her.
Through all this process Judy talked to them several times saying that Judy couldn’t do it alone but Judy's aunt told Judy that it was really difficult for her travel to see Judy. Even though they travelled to shop several times in the capital, coming for the day and didn’t even talking to Judy. Judy just got to know they were here because of social media.
By the end of the year Judy was exhausted, and was struggling so hard with her mental and physical health.

On december of 2019 Judy's mom passed away, and Judy started to take decisions such as with who Judy was going to live based on economic and personal things, and Judy decided to live with her boyfriend with whom Judy has been with for more than 3 years cause Judy doesn’t want to live alone. Judy is independent in terms of money since Judy got an insurance paid and Judy can sustain herself until Judy graduates med school.

But in January of this year, one month after Judy's mother passed away, Judy's aunt called Judy and asked Judy if Judy's cousin (M, 18) could live with Judy cause he is starting college in Judy's city, and Judy said no cause Judy doesn’t want to be in charge of someone after the year Judy has gone through, after feeling so alone and overwhelmed with everything.
After that answer Judy's aunt told Judy that it wasn’t going to be like that, that she didn’t want him to be alone, that Judy could teach him how to move around the city, and that sounded to Judy like taking care of someone and Judy stood with her decision of saying no.
Judy has seen her aunt a couple of times after that talk and recently Judy's aunt told Judy that she was really hurt by the decision Judy made because family is above Judy's boyfriend and stuff like that.

So reddit, AITA?

AITA for not wanting to meet his moms boyfriend who was part of the reason his parents separated? | So this starts back in 2017 when his parents split (they were never married but had been together for around 25ish years) shortly after his 16th birthday. His parents hadn't had the best relationship for a couple years prior but Nick being a kid he never really noticed until he looks back on it now. His mom tells him that she's moving out and that they're not together anymore. Obviously this messed him up but he thinks deep down he knew it was coming. Anyways she moves out and he lives part time with each of them. It comes to his attention that part of the reason they separated was because his mom was seeing a guy who lived in hawaii (he lives on the East Coast US but his parents are both flight attendants) named David (not his actual name) and he was furious with his mom for this and he still doesn't fully forgive her for it. Couple months pass and during the summer his mom asks him to come to hawaii with her and his grandmother and he didn't really think much of it because he and his family go on vacations every summer since they get free flights since they work for an airline. They have a really good trip until his mom wants him to meet David and his daughters and he lost his shit. He told her flat out that he never wanted to meet him and that she knew that and that he fucking hated this guy for being part of the reason his parents split up. She was very upset by this and his grandmother was too, and his grandmother tells him that the whole trip was just a reason for him to go meet him and he was livid. Nick and his mother have had arguments over it a couple times after this and he basically says he never wants to meet him and she wants him to meet him because he is an important person in her life and she thinks he should be involved with that. Not much happens until late fall 2018 where she asks him to go to a wedding with her in California (he doesn't know the people getting married or anyone else going except his mother) and her boyfriend and his entire family would be there. She asks him for a while and he sort of lied and told her he couldn't go because he had a huge paper due that week that he was doing in school (which isn't untrue) and she was really upset by this. She kept asking him to go and he kept saying no and that he is not ready for that. His dad found out and he was upset about it and said that she shouldn't be making him go if he didn't want to (his parents don't talk at all anymore). His mom starts crying and saying stuff like she doesn't understand why he doesn't wanna go and that its important to her and he told her he would meet them eventually (which for the record he really hopes he doesn't have to). After the wedding she kept trying to guilt trip him by bringing him stuff back from California like some staff exclusive apple shirts (Davids brother works for apple) and she said if he would've went he would've been able to tour the apple HQ and got a free apple watch and that kind of stuff. He understands where shes coming from that she wants him to meet him but he thinks she should respect his reasoning.

AITA for not wanting to stay for 6 months with his mother while she is going through divorce? | (First time posting, will edit if there are any issues or if some points not understood)

So here is the basic situation, Nick (23M) lives in a city which is 6 hours away by bus but 1 hour flight away from his home.

This is Nick's last semester, so after one month he finishes his university studies. Now in the middle of the semester when Nick went back home for one week (like a winter break) on the first day a fight broke between his parents (48M) (44F) and apparently his dad had another woman in his life other than his mom (not the first time btw), and on that week all hell broke loose. within 2 weeks his mother wanted to separate quietly but his dad wanted custody and his mom didn't agree, so his mom files a law suit for the divorce and in this whole time his dad is denying all this and saying that his mother is hallucinating (but he doesn't know that his mother has evidence on him and not planning on telling him until the day of the hearing which really makes arguing impossible).

Now Nick is living in a lively city, its like the newyork of his country and he loves it, he just met a girl he is in love with and its been going great, he is taking latin dance lessons and it really helped him take his mind of all this, his friends are here, the job potential is better here, his workout routine is set here, his network is here, everything that matters to him and that he did through all these 4 years is here in this city, unlike his hometown.

Yesterday Nick calls his mother to check on her as always, and she immediately starts asking when he is coming back and says that when he does he needs to stay by her side to support her and that she needs a man by her side (he saw this coming eventually and whenever the topic started in the past he always implied that he is not coming back to stay). The period she wants him to stay is 6 months, until the summer or until his 17 year old sister finishes her university exam and gets into university, then they can all move to the city that he studied in. When he told her that that is not possible and he is not willing to stay for that much all the time, she started arguing how he is selfish, not thinking about her and what shes going through and that he is her eldest son and she did not raise him to be like that type of person. Nick doesn't believe that his mom is going to move to his city without his dad having a word about that for the custody of his little sister, and if she leaves alone, what about his sisters? he doesn't know what is going on through her head.

Nick is willing to go back every 2 weeks back home, and willing to bounce on a plane given the emergency.

He gets it his mother is going through a tough time, he needs to be by her side, that his father cheated on her and its devastating, he gets it that family matters and family must come first, but he doesn't want to live in all that negativity and stress for that long, he doesn't need it, he doesn't want it.

AITA for not wanting to stay that long? is he really thinking that selfishly?

WIBTA If Judy didn't let her homeless mom live with her? | So Judy (18F) is also homeless but Judy is currently living at a shelter, whereas Judy's mom (55F) couch surfs daily. Judy and her mom used to live at the shelter together (they moved in when Judy was 17 so Judy's mom was still Judy's guardian) but Judy turned 18 while there and Judy's mom got kicked out on multiple occasions for staying out past curfew due to drug use and now Judy's mom isn't allowed back in, at least for a while. This is not the first time Judy has been homeless under her mom's guardianship.

But Judy is now an adult, and there is a housing program that Judy is in for homeless youths that will pay Judy's rent for 8 months or so which will allow Judy to save up and get a job in that time so Judy can pay the rent once the allotted time is up. They just need to find a place that meets the program guidelines, and recently Judy's case worker told Judy she found one that would be perfect and that if Judy wanted, Judy's mom could stay with Judy. But Judy isn't sure Judy wants her mom to.

First of all, it's an efficiency/studio, so it's one room Judy and her mom would have to share: and Judy's mother is not an easy person to share a room with. Judy's mom would also essentially be living rent free, riding off of Judy's opportunity, while Judy's mom most likely spends her disability money on drugs. Judy also doesn't trust the people Judy's mom hangs out with; Judy's mom doubles as a dealer and in the last 3 months Judy has had people actively seeking Judy out because Judy's mom owed them money and even threatening to hurt Judy (can't put the actual details because this sub doesn't allow talk of that stuff). Judy has thought about maybe having Judy's mom give Judy Judy's mom's money so Judy could budget it and make sure Judy's mom doesn't spend it on bad stuff, and also only letting Judy's mom stay if Judy's mom was sober, but this is not an easy job, plus Judy's mom is very manipulative/Judy is a pushover. Judy also doesn't think Judy would have it in Judy to kick Judy's mom out if Judy found out Judy's mom relapsed either.

That being said, Judy's mom is Judy's mom and while Judy's mom hasn't been the best to Judy, Judy loves Judy's mom even though Judy doesn't like Judy's mom and Judy doesn't think it's fair of Judy to leave Judy's mom out on the streets/in the houses of fellow drug users. Judy feels like no matter where Judy's mom is living Judy's mom is going to use anyway, so Judy's mom might as well be somewhere safe. Judy's mom hasn't done the greatest job taking care of Judy, but Judy can't deny Judy's mom's good moments either. Judy knows that's a mom's job/the bare minimum Judy's mom was required to do, but still Judy feels like Judy owes something. Judy also must admit that Judy will barely be there because Judy spends 90% of Judy's time with Judy's boyfriend. Judy basically lives at his house, but not fully because Judy can't (he lives with his parents and Judy needs Judy's own space to come back to as an introvert), so Judy would rarely be present to deal with any problems Judy's mom may cause.

So would Judy be the asshole, given all this, if Judy didn't let Judy's mom live with Judy? Judy feels like on one hand Judy is looking out for Judy's own safety and well being but on the other, Judy could be preventing Judy's mom from being on the streets and it might not even affect Judy that much, but Judy doesn't know.

Aita for not taking his brothers girlfriends daughter on a trip  
Nick is in his 50s and he and his wife of over 20 years have no children. They do enjoy kids and play the fun aunt and uncle to his brother and sisters kids. His siblings kids are younger. There’s 5 of them total ages ranging from 13-4. Nick loves them like they are his kids and his wife and he spend a lot of time with them. They also are pretty well off financially, so they love taking them to theme parks, downtown (their major city), and their vacation house.  

At the end of 2017, Nick's brother started to go through a very rough divorce, cheating involved. The kids have been very depressed and it sucks seeing the two of them carted around between their mom and dad. This year, Nick got a pretty nice bonus and decided his wife and he are going to take his brothers 2 kids and his sisters 3 kids to Disney World for a week. Nick is pretty excited as he is a Disney nerd himself. And the younger kids haven’t gone before so being there with them for their first time is an incredible feeling.  

At the end of 2018, Nick's brother has been dating again, and ended up finding someone he feels seriously about. They moved in together this past November. Nick has met her and she’s fine, she seems a little quiet for his brother but he seems happy and over the divorce so It’s all good. She has a 7 year old daughter who moved in with Nick's brother as well. He actually spends more time with the daughter of his girlfriend than his kids, since she spends all week there (dad not really In the picture) and his kids go there on the weekends. She is a sweet girl, but Nick has only been around her for more than just a hello probably twice. Apparently his oldest (the 13 year old) is annoyed with her, but she gets along really well with his youngest.  

Nick brought up the Disney vacation with his brother and sister and they are ecstatic. Nick extended the invites to them but neither of them are big on theme park vacations. So his brother asked Nick if he planned on taking (girlfriends daughter). Nick said honestly he was not planning on it. Nick explained that an extra child of that age would be too much for his wife and him to handle. And that his kids are still struggling with the separation, and having the child of their fathers new girlfriend on the trip might not be the best.  

He told Nick that it’s his money and he knows his kids will have fun so Nick can do what he wants. But he thinks that Nick is being an asshole. Because “he can afford it” and “they need to get to know her”. Nick snapped that he’s acting like this is his wife and he knows the child. Nick said this is a woman he has known for a little over a year and a kid that has lived with him for a few months.  

They haven’t talked since, his wife is saying that they should just take the daughter to avoid a problem with his brother. Nick does not want to. He would like this to be his own nieces and nephews in the wake of this divorce. He is not unwilling to get to know his girlfriend and kid, as he would like to and she is welcome to his home and all.  

So aita?

AITA if Judy no longer wants to be the maid of honour after getting kicked out of the house? | Judy moved from home the other side of the country two years ago. This year, at the end of March, Judy moved home and had nowhere to stay. Judy's sister and her fiance (let's call them S and F; also not engaged yet) have a spare room and let Judy stay with them in F's house. Judy was paying rent to them weekly. While there, Judy was living her own life - managing her own groceries, laundry, etc. If they decided to eat out, they would take turns paying.

A few days later, SF got engaged. S asked Judy to be her maid of honour for March 2020 after telling her that Judy didn't want to be part of another bridal party. Judy decided to do it for her even though they aren't close but she's family.

Judy gained her permanent residency around mid-May (a very big deal to her - been working towards this for the past 10 years) and decided to celebrate. Judy invited SF, her work mates and their respective partners to come for dinner. Everyone came along but SF. S said she didn't want to go because it will be so awkward for SF not knowing anyone.

Two days later, SF have their engagement party. Judy's parents are based overseas and Judy is the only immediate family member she has there. F has his parents and three sisters. All of them invite their friends along while Judy was not able to. Judy attended for S knowing that she will barely know any of the 100+ people there. Needless to say, Judy left after starting to feel uncomfortable when the familiar faces she knew retired early for the night. Hours later, Judy picked SF up from the pub (the afterparty) and dropped F's mates home as well.

Last night, Judy drove S to pick up F from the pub. F may have been drunk. On the way back, Judy took a turn too sharply and the rear wheel mounted the corner of a curb briefly. F proceeds to continuously carry on about how Judy is a dangerous driver. Judy pulls over and said if she was such a dangerous driver then he can get out of the car. F brings up the fact Judy is currently staying at his house and where else would she be if not there. Judy said she has people who she can stay with which he then proceeds to threaten saying it will be her last night there. He gets out of the car and walks the 500m back. Judy calls out to him to get back in the car but he kept on walking, so Judy drove off. On his walk back, he texts saying Judy is to be out of the house next week. This wasn't this first time F has threatened Judy with this. Judy was sick of constant insecurity of not having a place to stay and the lack of support from S that she packed a bag and left last night. Judy gets a text from F to come back as she was packing the car to leave, but nothing from S. Judy made the hour drive at 11pm to a colleague's place to stay until she can find a place of her own. They stayed up waiting for her and Judy was welcomed with a very warm hug.

As for today, Judy only received a text from S asking where she was and nothing from F.

AITA (Am I the Arsehole) for not cancelling plans Nick has with his Father to go out with the rest of his family (that hates him)? | First time poster, English isn't Nick's first language and he will try to give only the necessary information for judgement. but can add more details if needed.

Some info for context: Nick's (24m) father (55m) and Nick have had a very rocky relationship for a while. He skipped on court-ordered child support for Nick and his brothers (22m, 20m) for years and they pretty much had no contact from 2014-2019. In 2018, after they reached a settlement in Court, he started to pay CS again and gave them some land he had to cover the amount he didn't pay in the last four years (the land transfer was Nick's mother's idea)

Last year he reached out to Nick's brothers and Nick and they started a relationship with him (Nick's mother suggested that they talk to him to try and get him to pay more than what was decided on the settlement), however things went sour between him and Nick's brothers (as he paid child support after the deadline and "fired" Nick's brother that was - remotely - interning for him because his company wasn't doing well and he couldn't afford the extra costs), however Nick decided that he had no problem with him and kept the relationship going. Meanwhile Nick's relationship with his mother has been going from bad to worse, they fight constantly and she is very abusive towards him.

Well, last week Nick's father told him that he is coming to Nick's city (he lives 1250 miles away and comes for a week every month) invited Nick to dine alone with him on Tuesday (yesterday) and with Nick's boyfriend (23m) and Nick today (Wednesday), which Nick agreed to. He should add that his boyfriend is going a three-week trip on Saturday, so they did plan to see each other on today's dinner and tomorrow, also his boyfriend doesn't want to see Nick's mother for some time due to the way she has been treating Nick.

Today Nick received a text from his mother in the family whatsapp group saying that they're all going out to have dinner today to celebrate "their families achievements" (due to Nick's brothers recently getting paid internships), Nick then said that he couldn't today or tomorrow due to previous plans, but that he could every day from Friday and asked if they could reschedule.

She then asked what Nick was doing and Nick told her that he'd be staying over at his boyfriend's (which is true and he will) and couldn't reschedule because he wants to spend time with him before he travels (also true). No one said anything else, but then Nick's brother texted him angry saying that he knows Nick is going out with their father and not with his bf because their father invited him (Nick's brother) to come as well. He then told Nick's whole family what Nick was going to do and they are all furious with Nick that he is choosing his father over them and saying how he's ungrateful and that he is an awful person that this X Y and Z to them and how could Nick and etc. However they just sprung this dinner on Nick and he doesn't want to cancel on his dad AND ESPECIALLY he doesn't want to miss seeing his bf.

So, Reddit, AITA for Nick deciding to keep his plans instead of cancelling on his father and going out with them?

WIBTA if Judy refuses to go to a friend's wedding because she's not a bridesmaid but asked to clean? | So the players in this story are Judy, friend 1 (F1), friend 2 (F2), and Judy's mom.

So F1 and Judy have known each other since middle school. But they really didn't start being friends till the end of high school. After high school they still hung out, and would go to a Resteraunt once a week and wait till F1's boyfriend got off work at 11pm. Probably would hang out till midnight or later. One day Judy locked her keys in the car and F1 and her boyfriend said they had to go and left Judy in the parking lot alone at midnight while Judy waited for her mom to bring her spare key.

After that they didn't talk for 2 or 3 years until F1 reached out asking if Judy could take her mom to her cancer appt. since F1 couldn't that day. So Judy did. They started hanging out again. Judy would sit with F1's mom on Judy's days off and take F1's mom to cancer appts. They were heading to pick up F1's grandma 10 hours away and asked if Judy could come to help (Plus give F1's mom her booster shots since F1 hates needles). Last year F1's mom died of her cancer and Judy was with F1 and her mom when she was taken off life support.

This last year Judy was with F1 once or twice a week. Helping F1 cleaning the house, painting, doing the estate, etc. F1 always said no one else would come help her, she has no friends around them, etc.

Well F1 is getting married. F1 told Judy Judy wouldn't be a bridesmaid because F1 didn't want Judy to work, but relax at her wedding (honestly Judy doesn't care about this. It's F1's wedding) and F1's having people she met at comic cons out of state be her bridesmaids. F1's cousin who is on the other side of the country, F1 hardly sees, is her maid of honor because she's married and knows how weddings go. Then F1 asked Judy a few days later if Judy would hold the marriage certificate and help the venue clean up after the ceremony and before the reception. Judy agreed.

But now F2 and Judy's mom found out and said Judy shouldn't. That F1 should've chosen Judy to be a braidsmaid if not maid of honor (again Judy doesn't care about this, they do). That being married isn't an excuse to choose someone for being maid of honor and reminded Judy she had been it twice (To F2 and another friend) and that Judy did good. Said F1 is taking advantage of Judy. That Judy has done so much for F1 (helped with her mom and grandma, helped her with housework and errands, got her mail when she's gone, been her emotional crutch this last year, etc) and F1 hasn't done anything for Judy. Judy tells them F1 has gotten Judy a lot of stuff from comic cons Judy can't go to because of work but they said that's F1's choice (because Judy doesn't ask F1 to and F1 just gets it and gives Judy them).

They said after all Judy has done for F1 and how Judy has supported her Judy should be a bridesmaid at least. That Judy should just say work refused to give Judy the day off.

WIBTA if Judy refuses to go to the wedding and just go to work instead?

WIBTA if Nick didn't give his cousin the money from her graduation gift | Nick bought his little cousin a very nice and very generous piece of jewelry for her high school graduation a few weeks ago. Nick and his grandmother recently passed away, and had given him, as well as his sisters, the same item (a watch) for their high school graduations. So in his grandma's absence Nick gave her the watch, a simple and classic style Movado that set him back \~$500USD. It was significantly more than he had ever spent on a gift, but felt that this was an important occasion and this tradition was important in his family.

About a week ago Nick was checking his online banking, and noticed a chargeback on his card from the store for the full amount of the deposit (he financed the watch and would be making payments). Thinking it was a mistake, he called them and asked to speak to the manager. Wellll..... It turns out his cousin came in the very next day and returned the watch. The manager also added that the greeting card he had given with it was still in the bag and his cousin had left it behind asking if they wanted that back.

Nick felt so hurt. He didn't even know what to say. He felt hurt that she couldn't be honest with him about how she felt, he felt hurt she clearly didn't value his generosity, he felt hurt that she returned the item the next day.

Fast forward to yesterday: Nick's aunt called him up. She explained that his cousin had returned the watch as she felt uncomfortable with how much he had spent on her, and felt that she had no need for such a nice piece on jewelry in college. Nick said he was hurt but that he understood. His aunt proceeded to say that, however, she has a lot of things she needs like new clothes and dorm stuff and she could really use the money. She proceeds to say that she's talked to his cousin and it would be great if he could just Venmo her all of the money he spent on the watch.

Nick was so floored. If he had wanted to give her a cash gift he would have, but the only reason he spent that much money is because his sisters and he have all gotten that same watch from their Grandma and he didn't want her to feel hurt or left out. He thought it would be a nice surprise, but it was a lot for him and he had financed it, and it would be really financially uncomfortable for him to cough up such a large amount of money in one month. He let her know this.

Nick told all of that to his Aunt, and she proceeds to call him an Indian Giver and say that's disgusting, that he couldn't just not give his cousin a gift because she didn't want the watch, that he was ridiculous to give such an expensive piece of jewelry to a teenager, and that he should be proud of her for being responsible enough to want to spend the money on things that are more practical for her in this stage of her life. She said that it was incredibly tacky and selfish to get her so excited like this but then change his mind.

So WIBTA if Nick didn't give her the money?

Is Nick the Asshole for being difficult about a "mandatory" Monday meeting? | So just a heads up, Nick hasn't been on this subreddit almost at all, so if this doesn't fit/doesn't belong here please let him know and he'll edit/reupload/delete/whatever.

Nick works for a small, family-owned business (his family). He's been there for over 7 years now, through ups and downs, from the floor to an office he shares with the management types of the business. Things are extremely on the thin side right now, some of which was caused by his brother's management, but that's not part of this story. If they can get through the next little while, few months or so, things should be going extremely well for everyone involved.
